div.font: Where Education Becomes a Uniquely Woodland Experience

span.span: Woodland School will remain closed as directed by the Governor of Michigan.
As one of the first charter schools in the state, Woodland School
serves as a vibrant example of a healthy learning community.

div.span: Nestled within 250 acres of wooded land, our K-8 program provides a curriculum that is aligned with state standards but delivered in a way that promotes real life connections, student engagement, and a deep love of learning.

a.class: u_1467815715 dmButtonLink dmWidget dmWwr default dmOnlyButton dmDefaultGradient

span.span: If you are interested in serving on the Woodland School Board, please visit the office for more information and application materials. Serving on the Board is a rewarding way to contribute to Woodland School. To view Woodland School transparency or School Board Information click here.

span.b: Watching the Forest at Woodland School

span.span: When an oak wilt infestation led to clear cutting acres of trees on the forested campus of the Woodland School, teachers Lesley Goodrick-Scanlon and Ned Milne recognized the proverbial teachable moment. Teachers and students could learn how to steward forests together.

To help design a project that would engage the whole school, the teachers turned to the Grand Traverse Stewardship Initiative (GTSI) for guidance and assistance. GTSI provided teacher support, planning assistance, some funding and helped to engage appropriate experts. GTSI Director, Chelsea Nester helped to organize a school-wide professional development program focusing on the new 20-year forest management plan developed for the Woodland School’s 250 acre campus.
Watch the short video below to learn more and become inspired.

meta.content: Watching the Forest at Woodland School
Watching the Forest at Woodland School

center.h3: Watching the Forest at Woodland School

li.b: Multi-age classrooms emphasizing individualized learning and engaging curriculum.
Student and teacher-driven course content closely aligned with Michigan State Academic Standards.
Complete Arts program – Art, Choir, Band, Elementary Music, Theater, and Set Design.

span.b: 250 acres of wooded land, numerous trails, and several small lakes.

li.b: An educational community designed to inspire creativity, foster responsibility, & instill confidence.

b.span: These are merely a few details that set our program apart from others.
To learn about our program and enrollment process click below.

div.span: Woodland School is a Kindergarten through 8th grade, tuition-FREE, public charter school that fosters a deep love of learning through creative curriculum and a unique environment.
We have been serving the greater Grand Traverse region since 1996.
